item.title: Customizing string interpolation in C# 6
item.description: One of the major new features in C# 6 is string interpolation, which allows you to write things like this: string text = $"{p.Name} was born on {p.DateOfBirth:D}"; A lesser known aspect of this feature is that an interpolated string can be treated either as a String, or as an IFormattable, depending on the context.
